bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to George L. Rives
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Consulate General of the U.S.
Monrovia, March 19th 1888.
Mr B. Y. Payne, to the Ass't Sec'y State.
Receipt of his Circular of Jan'y 26th 1888.

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your Circular with interrogations relating to the coinage, production, consumption, import and export of precious metal, paper and metalic circulation, and other information bearing upon financial matters affecting British Guinea, and I beg to advise that as as
as the required information was or is not obtainable in Liberia, I transmitted a copy of same to the Consular Agent at Elmina, Gold Coast, with instruction to furnish the information obtainable by him at his earliest convenience.

I have the honor to be
Sir,
Your obedient Servant,
Beverly Y. Payne,
U.S. Act'g Vice COnsul Gen'l
div1.fw:
Hon. G. L. Rives,
Assistant Secy State
&c &c &c
